data.title: Extension commands best practices
data.body:
Hi,

I have a question regarding the best practices / conventions for commands that are provided by extensions: 

**Should command be prefixed with a common name that identifies the extension or rather not?**

In my case I have two commands:
- Sort imports
- Save file without sorting imports

Should I prefix them? e.g.:
- sort-imports: Sort imports
- sort-imports: Save file without sorting imports

Sorry if this is the wrong place to ask.

data.title: c++ header <iostream> not recognised in vscode 1.4.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Hi all,

I've discovered a small bug while trying to code in c++ using vscode. I have to point out that i`m a noob in vscode.
It doesn't recognise the iostream header, unless i edit c_cpp_properties.json file.
By default, in this config file the includePath is set to "includePath": ["/usr/include"]. 
In order to make vscode compile my program, i needed to edit the includePath to  ["/usr/include/"].
The odd behaviour is that vscode does not show the error below for all programs.
Some programs are compiled without modifying the includePath.

![include_error_in_vsc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11255266/17642356/dde6a944-614a-11e6-95e0-f6cdc60f44be.PNG)

If you have any ideas why this is happening, please share them, i would like to edit vscode's settings to take effect globally, on all c++ programs, without having to manually edit the includePath individually for each c++ program.

Thanks!

data.title: Problem with PHP syntax check in Visual Code.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I open a file PHP, show error like:

> phpcs: Unable to locate phpcs. Please ad phpcs to your global path or use composer dependency manager to install it in your project locally.
> 
> phpmd: No such phpmd executable: phpmd
1. I tried to fix it by install pear.phar.

2.1. `php go-pear.phar`
2.2. `pear install PHP_CodeSniffer`
2.3. 

```
pear channel-discover pear.phpmd.org
pear channel-discover pear.pdepend.org
pear install --alldeps phpmd/PHP_PMD
```

And edit user config to:

```
{
    "files.encoding": "windows1252",
    "php.validate.executablePath": "C:/wamp64/bin/php/php5.6.19/php.exe",
    "phpmd.validate.executablePath": "C:/wamp64/bin/php/php5.6.19/phpmd.bat",
    "php.validate.run": "onType"
}
```
1. Don't have an error but syntax checker seems to have a problem.
   You can see, I don't have any error, but it shows much errors(red line):

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4168981/17641643/5da6e67e-6152-11e6-8a16-993c5dbd2177.PNG)

data.title: PowerShell in integrated terminal sometimes has no cmdlet like "Set-PSReadLineOption" and fails to load module
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Configure settings:

``` json
"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\System32\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe"
```
1. Launch integrated terminal (related commands are configured in my PS profile):

```
Set-PSReadLineOption : The term 'Set-PSReadLineOption' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.

Import-Module : The specified module 'posh-git' was not loaded because no valid module file was found in any module directory. 
```

The interesting thing is that, sometimes everything will just work without an issue.

data.title: Feature request: 'smart' scroll-lock in DEBUG console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
  Version 1.4.0
  Commit 6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679
  Date 2016-08-04T16:49:32.489Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Ubunt 12.04

The debug console automatically scrolls to the end of the output when new output appears. This can be very annoying if both of these are true: 

 a) the app being debugged is printing something regularly
 b) you are scrolling up trying to read something that was already scrolled out of view

Basically, it is impossible to read output already out of view because the view just keep snapping back to the bottom.

The way this works in Linux terminal is that the 'scroll to new output' behavior is automatically disabled when I scroll up. Conversely, it also gets auto-enabled when I scroll back down to the bottom.

In other words _if_ I am already scrolled so that I'm looking at the logs 'tail' then the view keeps the tail scrolled into view as new output appears. But if I'm not currently looking at the tail, then it doesn't auto-scroll. 

This is exactly how it should work I think. If that's too hard to implement, then at least give the user some kind of button to toggle scroll-lock on / off.

PS: I observed the annoying scrolling behavior in DEBUG console, but it really applies to all consoles (e.g. 'build' task console with 'watching' behavior).

data.title: Reusing repo README for marketplace is restrictive; add an option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Apologies if this is the wrong place for this...

The docs for the manifest file state:

> Have a README.md Markdown file in your extension's root folder and we will include the contents in the body of the extension details (on the Marketplace). 

I recently got some comments that the Readme for my extension on GitHub is not very good to tell people what the project. I could add this to the top of the README, but it's redundant on the marketplace (as is installation instructions, which currently appear twice because I have them in my readme).

It would be great to have the option of using a different file than the same readme that GitHub will show on a repo page. That way, the GitHub-displayed README.md could explain what the project is and how to install it, whereas the marketplace-displayed file could omit this stuff (people on the marketplace or inside Code already know it's an extension and how to install it).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn on Japanese IME
2. Type "this" (s)
3. ctrl+shift+left
4. Type "this" again, you get this:

I think the ideal fix for this is to disable selection while an IME composition is happening.

data.title: Cannot start WAMP server from terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use powershell in terminal
2. Open wampmanager.exe directly or as alias

I use powershell in terminal and I have WAMP alias set in my _Microsoft.Powershell_profile.ps1_
`new-item alias:wamp -value C:\wamp\wampmanager.exe`
When I start it with `wamp` or directly with `C:\wamp\wampmanager.exe` my WAMP server starts but with all services inactive (red icon) and I can't activate them.

But it works when I use it directly in powershell. Why is that?

data.title: npm test fails on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

I don't know if I'm doing this right, but I'm trying to set up my extension up on AppVeyor to run tests. It works fine on Jenkins (Linux and OS X) but fails on AppVeyor. I can repro on my Windows desktop.

I'm running `npm test` (I presume this is correct - it seems to do the expected thing on Linux/Mac) but I get this output:

```
npm test --silent
### VS Code Extension Test Run ###
Current working directory: C:\projects\dart-code
Downloading VS Code into "C:\projects\dart-code\.vscode-test" from: https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/1.4.0/linux-x64/stable
Running extension tests: C:\projects\dart-code\.vscode-test\VSCode-linux-x64\code C:\projects\dart-code\out\test --extensionDevelopmentPath=C:\projects\dart-code --extensionTestsPath=C:\projects\dart-code\out\test
Failed to execute tests: Error: spawn C:\projects\dart-code\.vscode-test\VSCode-linux-x64\code ENOENT
Tests exited with code: -4058
Command exited with code 1
```

It seems to be downloading a **Linux** version of code. I tracked this back to `node_modules/vscode/bin/test` which has a platform check that only supports Linux and Mac:

```
var platform = (process.platform === 'darwin') ? 'darwin' : 'linux-x64';
```

So, two questions:
1. What's the correct way to run tests on Windows/AppVeyor (I found [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/5979/files) though I'm not sure if relevant)
2. Is there any reason `npm test` can't be made to work? All the pieces are cross-platform, it would be nice if this just worked the same everywhere

data.title: Confusing behaviour with word highlighter overriding document highlighter
data.body:
It's possible this is intended, or a problem with our code, but I can't find any discussion about it to confirm...
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

We've implemented a document highlighter that highlights symbols in the document. If you put your cursor inside an item, it works as expected:

![As expected](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17621440/3c05ea28-608b-11e6-88d0-aa69416d173f.png)

However if you double-click to highlight the element, then the results from the document highlight are overriden (or supplemented with) word highlgihts be vscode (resulting in incorrect things behind highlighted):

![Not expected](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17621457/5598b128-608b-11e6-973b-3c82df88b3c4.png)

I see the same behaviour in TypeScript so I don't think it's our bug (and is probably intended) but I thought it was worth clarifying. It's not what I'd expect (as a user). If there is no document highlighter registered this would be fine, but in this case I think extensions should have the say in what's highlighted. (I think Fat VS does what I'm asking for here?)

data.title: Setting Git Sync Keybinding Breaks Git View Keybinding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional (SP1)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change `keybindings.json` to the following: 
   
   ```
   // Place your key bindings in this file to overwrite the defaults
   [
       {"key": "ctrl+shift+g ctrl+shift+s",    "command": "workbench.action.git.sync"}                                     
   ]
   ```
2. The new action works, but now when trying to access git with `ctrl + shift + g`, I am seeing the message:

> (Ctrl + Shift + G) was pressed. Waiting for second key of chord...

Even though the default keybindings still contain

`{ "key": "ctrl+shift+g",          "command": "workbench.view.git" }`
1. I also tried including `"when": "editorFocus"` to my Sync keybinding but with no luck.

data.title: Make editor.snippetSuggestions: bottom the default
data.body:
I think we should make `editor.snippetSuggestions: bottom` the default. If I am a user and I see this:

![screen shot 2016-08-12 at 12 29 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/17619865/7e49e978-6088-11e6-8412-808f3b96f1b3.png)

My first reaction is that IntelliSense is stupid and not picking up the valid values. When I change to the setting, I get this:

![screen shot 2016-08-12 at 12 29 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/17619877/8fcbc112-6088-11e6-94fa-c45ad30fbf20.png)

Which indicates to  me that the editor actually knows what I am doing.

@jrieken @aeschli @egamma fyi
